content:
From: Christian Maeder <Christian.Maeder@dfki.de>
Thanks, it is unchanged! I was only confused by the message (below) and
did not press return to avoid (re-)building HOL (only).

"isabelle make HOLCF" in HOL/HOLCF rebuilds all heaps (Pure, HOL, HOLCF)
and puts them under ~/.isabelle/...

Christian

Press RETURN to compilation of

HOL
(targets: HOLCF)

From: Makarius <makarius@sketis.net>
BTW, since both Pure and HOL are now the standard bundle it should have
worked without rebuilding any of them.

Makarius

From: Christian Maeder <Christian.Maeder@dfki.de>
I wrongly assumed this suggests to build HOL instead of HOLCF!

C.

From: Christian Maeder <Christian.Maeder@dfki.de>
Am 31.01.2011 11:00, schrieb Makarius:

Isabelle2011 is now available.
[...]

  • HOLCF: reorganization of library and related tools.

How should I build HOLCF now? Where should I get the sources from?

Thanks Christian

From: Alexander Krauss <krauss@in.tum.de>
Christian Maeder wrote:
Isabelle2011/build -m HOLCF

Alex

From: Tobias Nipkow <nipkow@in.tum.de>
It is now in HOL/HOLCF and you build it in HOL with
isabelle make HOLCF

Tobias

Christian Maeder schrieb:
